document.masterDocTitle: The genus Colletes (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Colletidae) in Central Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Colletes (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Colletidae) in Central Asia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Colletes tuberculatus Morawitz 1893 : 80
–81, ♀, ♂ ( type locality: “Serbent, Jagnob: Ravat, Turusch-Dara-Pass, Iskander-kul, Takfon, Kschtut, Darch”, Tadjikistan ).

Colletes tuberculatus siculus Noskiewicz 1959 : 511
–513, ♀, ♂ ( type locality: Etna, Sicily). Syn. nov.
Colletes tuberculatus anatolicus Noskiewicz 1959 : 513
–515 ♀, ♂ ( type locality: Nigda, Turkey ). Syn. nov.
Colletes daviesanus tuberculatus : Warncke 1978 : 349
–350.

Colletes tuberculatus siculus Noskiewicz 1959
and
C. t. anatolicus Noskiewicz 1959
are here synonymized with
Colletes tuberculatus Morawitz 1894
. Both species were described based on slight differences of the colour of pilosity and the breadth of apical metasomal tergal hair bands. These characters vary with the climatic conditions the bees live in (steppic to temperate) and are unsuitable for a taxonomic differentiation. Within the taxonomically difficult
C. fodiens
species-group
C. tuberculatus
is well characterized with the intraspecific morphological and colour variation not exceeding that of other widespread
Colletes
species like
C. cunicularius (Kuhlmann 2000 )
,
C. fodiens (Kuhlmann & Proshchalykin 2011 )
,
C. floralis
or
C. chengtehensis
(Kuhlmann 2009 b). Thus, it is not justified to retain subspecies in
C. tuberculatus
.
